akn:section.akn:heading: By what methods river and harbor work may be authorized to be prosecuted

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 621. By what methods river and harbor work may be authorized to be prosecuted Any public work on canals, rivers, and harbors adopted by Congress may be prosecuted by direct appropriations, by continuing contracts, or by both direct appropriations and continuing contracts. (Sept. 22, 1922, ch. 427, § 10, 42 Stat. 1043.)
Editorial Notes Codification Section is from the Rivers and Harbors Appropriation Act of 1922.
